book.description: Basic book information displayed in header
book.title: Tuesdays at Six
book.author: Lilli North
book.subtitle: A second-chance, high-heat rural romance
book.description: Emma Jacobs never expected to return to her family’s horse farm in northern England. Drawn home by grief, she reconnects with Luke Carter, her childhood best friend and first love. Bound by a weekly Tuesday ritual, they navigate loss, memory, and longing in a story of second chances, slow-burn intimacy, and small-town ties that refuses to let go.

audienceMatch.title: Audience Match
audienceMatch.engagement: Strong global digital-first romance audience with crossover into women’s fiction
audienceMatch.keyCharacteristics: Digital-first, female-led readership with strong audio/ebook preference; highly engaged in online romance communities
audienceMatch.detailedAnalysis: The readership is anchored by women aged 25–44 who actively engage in BookTok, Bookstagram, and audiobook platforms. They favour emotionally authentic romances that blend grief and healing with high-heat intimacy, especially within small-town or rural settings. Secondary audiences from women’s fiction and mature drama add further breadth, discovering the book through libraries, drama tie-ins, and traditional outlets.

analysisOverview.title: Analysis Overview
analysisOverview.readership: The book connects strongly with a digitally fluent, romance-driven readership who consume through ebooks and audiobooks and value narratives of love rediscovered after loss.
analysisOverview.classification: Using a bespoke sub-genre taxonomy, the work positions itself as a high-heat second-chance contemporary romance that intersects with small-town life, grief-and-healing arcs, and friends-to-lovers tropes, filling a gap in UK-set rural romance.
analysisOverview.personas: The primary persona, Sarah the Nostalgic Romantic, embodies the heart of the readership: digitally active, socially connected, and seeking affirmation of enduring love. The secondary persona, David the Reflective Widower, highlights male crossover interest and a desire for emotionally resonant stories of renewal.
analysisOverview.marketingGuidance: Marketing insights provide clear direction for early-stage campaigns, suggesting creative hooks rooted in ritual, grief-to-love arcs, and rural texture. These can shape copy, video teasers, and book club positioning. While currently delivered within this report, future iterations will expand into a standalone marketing toolkit.

sampleCopy.title: Sample Copy
sampleCopy.backCoverBlurb: Emma Jacobs never thought she’d return to her family’s farm in northern England. But when grief calls her home, she finds more than just memories waiting. Luke Carter, her childhood best friend and first love, is still there — steady, loyal, and impossible to ignore. As Tuesdays at six bring them back together, Emma must decide if she can face her past to embrace a future rooted in love and belonging.
